title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the budget must be submitted to the President for transmission to Congress, following specific procedures outlined in the Act. The Act prohibits unauthorized obligations and expenditures by District of Columbia government officials, requiring approval by the Council or Congress during control years. The Act prohibits unauthorized obligations and expenditures by District of Columbia government officials during control years. Reprogramming of budget amounts requires approval from the Mayor and Council, with offsetting expenditures for any additional funding requests. Congressional review period for budget acts is also specified in the Act. The Act specifies the length of the Congressional review period for budget acts, stating that an Act will take effect after a 30-calendar-day period unless a joint resolution disapproving it is enacted within that time frame. The Congressional review period for budget acts can be extended by 5 days if neither House is in session due to adjournment, recess, or adjournment of more than three days. If a joint resolution disapproving an Act passes both Houses and is transmitted to the President within the applicable period, it will repeal the Act upon becoming law. The Congressional review period for budget acts can be extended by 5 days if neither House is in session. A joint resolution disapproving an Act will repeal it upon becoming law. Various sections of the Act are amended for conformity. The Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 and the National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997 are amended to update references to section 446. The table of contents of the Act is also amended for clarity. SEC. 3. Action by Council of District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission of documents to the President. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to clarify terminology within the subsection. The wording in Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to clarify the transmission of documents to the President. A new paragraph is added to define the term 'control year' as per the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 4 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process during control years, restricting the approval of budgets not consistent with the financial plan. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to define the term 'control year' in alignment with the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. SEC. 6 states that any general provision in an appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the next fiscal year's appropriation bill is enacted. SEC. 7 specifies that the amendments in the Act apply to the District of Columbia's budgets starting from October 1, 2004.
